thread.title: State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor
thread.title_full: State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor

author: Detroit Free Press
title: State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor
text:
State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor State Sen. Coleman Young II says he wants to be Detroit mayor Post to Facebook State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor State Sen. Coleman Young II says he wants to be Detroit mayor  //on.freep.com/2lxGsWa   Join the Conversation To   State Sen. Coleman Young II says he's running for Detroit mayor Ann Zaniewski , Detroit Free Press Published 9:35 p.m. ET Feb. 19, 2017 | Updated 9 minutes ago Young is term-limited as a state senator in 2018 Sen. Coleman Young II, a Detroit Democrat, speaks against legislation to bail out and restructure Detroits school district in the Senate chamber on Wednesday, June 8, 2016, in Lansing, Mich. (Photo: David Eggert, AP) 2 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A Michigan state senator says he wants to follow in his famous father's footsteps and become the next mayor of Detroit. 
Coleman Young II announced his candidacy this evening on-air during a broadcast program on 88.1 WHPR Radio & TV, according to published reports by TV news stations WXYZ and WDIV . He did not return messages from the Free Press seeking comment. 
A former state representative, Young is term-limited in the Michigan Senate in 2018. 
Related news: Lansing’s Virg Bernero to seek 4th term as mayor 
His late father, Coleman Young, was Detroit's first black mayor and one of its most influential — and controversial — leaders. He was also the city's longest serving mayor, his term running from 1974-1994. 
Last fall, Coleman Young II, a Democrat from Detroit, told the Free Press he hadn't made any decisions about seeking another public office. 
"I'm going to keep my options open," he said at the time. 
Alexis Wiley, chief of staff to Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan, said the mayor was not surprised by Young's announcement. Duggan announced earlier this month that he's seeking re-election. 
"The mayor’s expected it for a long while, that he was going to be running," Wiley said Sunday night. "And we expect that he won’t be the only person who gets into the race between now and the filing deadline." 
The filing deadline is April 25. The primary will be held Aug. 8; the election is Nov 7. 
Contact staff writer Ann Zaniewski at 313-222-6594 or azaniewski@freepress.com. Follow her on Twitter: @AnnZaniewski. 2 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE
